txt.en: The stone marker has been removed
You have found the stone marker
The Ranger Culang has learned of a great treasure buried long ago by a DÃºnadan-landholder and wants it recovered before it is found by tomb-robbers.

The inscription on this stone marker is barely legible, but these words can just be made out:

  \qFrom this beach, you can see Rantost,
   A short swim across the water.\q

This new riddle may reveal the true location of the treasure.

The treasure may lie beneath another stone marker, somewhere in Evendim, if this riddle is to be believed:

  \qFrom this beach, you can see Rantost,
   A short swim across the water.\q

You should examine the marker when you find it for some clue to the location of the treasure.

The stone marker is surrounded by signs of digging; if it once marked the location of the treasure, it has surely been found.\n\nThe marker bears an inscription, all but worn away by the passage of time.
Your search for the stone marker was fruitless; it appears to have been removed from the location specified in the directions. But it seems that someone has taken interest in your activities....

Percy Alroyd's camp is on Rantost Island just off the north-eastern shore of Lake Evendim.

Bert Yould, a man who seems to be something of a brigand himself, told you that a brigand-leader named Percy Alroyd has carried away the stone marker you were looking for.

The inscription on this stone marker is barely legible, but these words can just be made out:

  \qFrom this beach, you can see Rantost,
   A short swim across the water.\q

This new riddle may reveal the true location of the treasure.

'Hallo there. I see you seem strangely interested in that old stone. Well, you're not the only one. Seems that old rogue, Percy Alroyd, took a fancy to it and dragged it off to his camp right on Rantost Island over there.\n\n'Huh? Why do I tell you all this? Well Alroyd's no friend of mine. Stole some of my hard-earned loot just last week. So if you want to get him back for me, feel free, that's all I have to say.'

'Another riddle? You are jesting! How does this one go?

  \qFrom this beach, you can see Rantost,
   A short swim across the water.\q

'Rantost is an island to the north of Tinnudir, claimed now by tomb-robbers. Look for a beach on the mainland from which you can see Rantost, and I would wager you might find the treasure!'
Find the solution to the riddle
